text: Generator sizing, voltage, phase, and fuel type match electrical schedule and one-line diagram
ATS ratings, number of poles, and location per shop drawings and CSA C282 (or NEC Article 700/701)
Life safety system loads separated and properly labeled
Generator pad and housing installed per manufacturer spec with seismic anchoring (if required)
Exhaust, intake, and fuel lines routed and tested for leaks
Generator grounding electrode and bonding installed and tested
ATS installed level, wired correctly for both normal and emergency sources
Critical loads wired per fire/life safety codes with no unauthorized loads connected
Generator pre-start inspection completed: oil, coolant, battery, fuel, alarms
Generator started manually and under automatic transfer
ATS functionality verified: time delay, sensing, transfer, re-transfer
Emergency loads picked up and de-energized without issue during test
Load bank test or connected full-load test conducted and recorded (as required)
Run time verification per spec (e.g., 2 hrs full load or as per CSA/NEC)
As-built single-line, test logs, fuel certification (for diesel), and CSA/UL label on generator submitted
Local AHJ or fire department signoff completed

id: • CSA C282, NEC Articles 700/701, NFPA 110, UL 2200, NBC Part 3 & 6
• Manufacturer Specs: Generac, Kohler, Cummins, MTU, ASCO, Eaton
